nodeMetric.field_description: Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) Growth Rate is the velocity at which MRR is being added to the business, expressed as a percentage. MRR Growth Rate is often cited as a monthly rate, but it's also possible to express it using an annual timeframe; for example, "we are targeting 10% MRR Growth for April", or "our MRR Growth Rate was 100% last year".
field_formula: (Total MRR end of period - Total MRR beginning of period) / (Total MRR beginning of period)
nodeMetric.field_benchmark: According to the KeyBanc 2019 SaaS Survey, the average annual MRR Growth Rate across all companies surveyed was 52%.
nodeMetric.field_example:
A recurring revenue business increased its MRR from $250K at the beginning of the month to $265K at the end of the month. 

(Total MRR end of period - Total MRR beginning of period) / (Total MRR beginning of period)

Net MRR Growth = MRR at the end of the period - MRR at the beginning of the period = $15K
$15K / $250K = 6% MRR Growth Rate per month

body.summary: Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) Growth Rate is the percentage at which Net MRR is increasing or decreasing.

field_related_metrics.field_description: Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) is the sum of all subscription revenue expressed as a monthly value. For most companies, MRR is the sum of all new business subscriptions and upgrades (sometimes called expansion), minus downgrades (or contractions) and cancelled subscriptions. Though not a Generally Accepted Accounting Principle (GAAP) value, it's the Revenue equivalent used by every SaaS company. MRR is used interchangeably with ARR.
Revenue is the income generated through a business' primary operations, such as the sale of products or services, or proceeds from rent or interest, less any discounts or returns.

Won Opportunities is the count of sales opportunities that are “Closed Won”. It is a measure of success of the Sales and Marketing teams. "Closed Won" is the stage at which a quote or proposal has been signed or electronically accepted and is now considered fulfillable. Counter to Won Customers, Won Opportunities apply to both new and existing customers.

field_compare_metrics.title: MRR Renewal Rate vs Net MRR Churn Rate
